Class GraphicalCalculatorFrame.GraphicalCalculatorPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GraphicalCalculatorFrame.GraphicalCalculatorPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    GraphicalCalculatorFrame

    private final class GraphicalCalculatorFrame.GraphicalCalculatorPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Interactive panel that the user clicks on to modify portions of an equation. The panel effectively works as a simple equation editor. The panel has 5 regions that may be clicked - 3 operand regions and 2 operator regions. That is, the Panel displays an expression with 5 editable regions. Regions are marked by a black bounding box and when the region is clicked it is "selected" and highlighted yellow. The equation represented by this panel is of the form: operand0 operator0 operand1 operator1 operand2 = result

      • highlight

        java.awt.Color highlight
        Color to highlight the selected region:

      • regions

        java.awt.Rectangle[] regions
        The editable regions. These are stored as rectangles to represent where to draw them as well as to represent the area on the panel that selects the region when clicked. regions[0] refers to the left-most region displayed

      • textPoints

        java.awt.Point[] textPoints
        The points at which the parts of the equation are drawn (operators, operands, = sign, result). The regions are drawn around the displayed text for the editable parts of the equation.

      • selectedRegion

        private int selectedRegion
        The region selected that should be highlighted yellow.

      • operands

        private int[] operands
        The operands of the equation. Used for evaluation and for drawing the expression.

      • operators

        private java.lang.String[] operators
        The operators of the equation. Used for evaluation and for drawing the expression.

      • GraphicalCalculatorPanel

        public GraphicalCalculatorPanel()
        Creates the panel and sets up the listeners and member variables.

    • Method Detail

      • setupRegions

        private void setupRegions()
        Set up the regions that may be clicked. The regions are associated with the operands and operators as such: region0 = operand0 region1 = operator0 region2 = operand1 region3 = operator1 region4 = operand2

      • setupTextPoints

        private void setupTextPoints()
        Sets up the points at which text is drawn (i.e. the parts of the equation)...

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the bounding boxes for all the regions in the panel. Draws the text representing the expression. Highlights the selected region.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object for drawing.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        When the panel is clicked, check if the point clicked lies within any of the editable regions of the expression. If so, that region set to the be the new selected region. Repaint at the end. (hint: look at the java.awt.Rectangle class for useful methods that you can use to check if a point is within the rectangle)
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • setSelectedRegionContents

        public boolean setSelectedRegionContents(java.lang.String content)
        Attempts to set the content of the selected region. If the region is and operand the content must be a single-digit number (0-9). If the region is an operator the content must be "+", "-", or "*". Should call repaint at the end.
        Parameters:
        content - The value that the program will attempt to set the selected region to.
        Returns:
        True if the region content is sucessfully set. False otherwise.

      • evaluate

        public int evaluate()
        Evaluates the equation on the panel. Operations are performed left-to-right, ignoring operator precendence (e.g. and equation of 2+3*4 will return (2+3)*4 = 20)
        Returns:
        The evaluation of the expression displayed by the Panel.
